Module COMP2042.CW.hfyxc3
Package brickdestroyer.model.entities

Class Brick

java.lang.Object
brickdestroyer.model.entities.Brick
All Implemented Interfaces:
Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlackStoneBrick, CementBrick, ClayBrick, HasteBrick, SteelBrick
public abstract class Brick extends Object implements Entity
Abstract Brick class is the superclass of all concrete brick class in the game. This class contains all the basic behavior and the getter/setter of brick properties.

  • Constructor Details

    • Brick

      public Brick(String name, javafx.geometry.Point2D position, javafx.geometry.Dimension2D size, javafx.scene.paint.Color borderColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color innerColor, int strength)
      Creates a new brick shape with the given name, size, color, position and strength properties.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the child brick class.
      position - The X and Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the child brick class.
      size - The width/height dimension of child brick class.
      borderColor - The outline color of the child brick class.
      innerColor - The interior color of the child brick class.
      strength - The number of impact the child brick class can receive.

  • Method Details

    • makeBrickFace

      protected abstract javafx.scene.shape.Shape makeBrickFace(javafx.geometry.Point2D position, javafx.geometry.Dimension2D size)
      An abstract makeBall method for the derived brick class to be implemented. The method returns the newly created derived brick shape along with the specified properties. This method defines the overall brick shape to be drawn in the game window.
      Parameters:
      position - a Point2D x and y position of the upper-left corner of the brick to be created.
      size - a Dimension2D value width/height dimension of the brick to be created.
      Returns:
      a new brick shape with the specified upper-left corner position and radius.

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact()
      Sets the impact of a non-crackable brick. This method is called when the ball impacted the brick in any direction.
      Returns:
      a boolean value which return true if the brick is destroyed, false if it's not.

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, Brick.ImpactDirection direction)
      Sets the impact of crackable brick when it is hit by the ball. This method is an overloaded method of the setImpact() method and created specifically for crackable brick.
      Parameters:
      point - a Point2D x and y position impact by the ball.
      direction - an Impact Direction enum value in the Brick class that specifies the direction of the ball when it impacts the brick.
      Returns:
      a boolean value which return true if the brick is destroyed, false if it's not.

    • impact

      public void impact()
      This method is called by setImpact() method to decrement the strength of the brick and determine if the brick is broken.

    • repair

      public void repair()
      Repair the condition of the brick.

    • getCrackPath

      public abstract javafx.scene.shape.Path getCrackPath()
      An abstract getCrackPath method for the derived ball class to be implemented. It returns the path element of a brick that contains the crack path element position to be drawn in the game window. The value could be null if the class doesn't support crack features.
      Returns:
      a Path that contains path elements of the crack path to be drawn in the game window.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Getter method for the name specified for the brick. This method is called to generate different brick types using the brick factory and specifies the use of setImpact() overloading method for crackable brick and default brick.
      Returns:
      the name of the brick.

    • isBroken

      public boolean isBroken()
      Getter method for the condition of whether the brick. This method is used to determine if a crack path is needed to be drawn on a brick.
      Returns:
      a boolean value which return true when the brick is broken, false if it's not.

    • getBrickFace

      public javafx.scene.shape.Shape getBrickFace()
      Getter method for the property of the shape brick such as the position, shape and so on. This method is called to check the direction of impact from the ball.
      Returns:
      a Shape that represent and contains the properties of a brick shape.

    • getBorderColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getBorderColor()
      Getter method for the border color of the brick. It defines the stroke color of the brick in the game window.
      Specified by:
      getBorderColor in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Color that contains the sRGB value of the border color of the brick.

    • getInnerColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getInnerColor()
      Getter method for the inner color of the brick. It defines the fill color of the brick in the game window.
      Specified by:
      getInnerColor in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Color that contains the sRGB value of the inner color of the brick.

    • getXPosition

      public double getXPosition()
      Getter method for the upper-left corner x bound of the brick. It defines the x position starting point of the brick to be generated and drawn in the game window. The value of it can only be positive.
      Specified by:
      getXPosition in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Double that contains the upper-left x bound of the brick.

    • getYPosition

      public double getYPosition()
      Getter method for the upper-left corner y bound of the brick. It defines the y position starting point of the brick to be generated and drawn in the game window. The value of it can only be positive.
      Specified by:
      getYPosition in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Double that contains the upper-left y bound of the brick.

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()
      Getter method for the width of the brick. It defines the brick length in pixels to be drawn on the x plane of the game window. The value of width can only be positive.
      Specified by:
      getWidth in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Double that contains the width of the brick.

    • getHeight

      public double getHeight()
      Getter method for the height at the of the brick. It defines the brick length in pixels to be drawn on the y plane of the game window. The value of height can only be positive.
      Specified by:
      getHeight in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Double that contains the height of the brick.
